Fields.DialogueText: Good morning, Leberecht. How are you doing today?
Mir geht es gut, danke! What about you? You seem rather chipper.
Why wouldn't I be? I'm with one of my favorite people.
Flattery will get you nowhere, Kapitän.
It wasn't flattery! I mean, it might have been flattering, but I was telling the truth. Why wouldn't I be?
Considering I've never been referred to as anyone's favorite person in the past, I'm not exactly predisposed to believe you now.

Fields.MenuText: This isn't the past, Leberecht. As far as I'm concerned, in the present, you have many great qualities.
I suppose I'll just have to convince you that I'm telling the truth.
Are you trying to convince me not to like you?

Fields.DialogueText: We'll see whether the future supports your present opinion.
Heh. I'm positive you have better uses for your time, Kapitän.
Nein! Natürlich nicht! Just understand, that's what I've come to expect from most people.
Well, my opinion remains unchanged, Leberecht. I wouldn't want to captain this ship without you by my side.
Ha! Well, it's not as if you have a choice in the matter. But I do appreciate your kind words, Kapitän.
*ALARM*
Now, I do believe we have other responsibilities to attend to.
Let's get to it!
@BATTLE
Kapitän! Nixen have been spotted portside. We need you.
I'm on my way.
@BATTLE
L-look out there... it looks as if there's a pretty large storm on the horizon. It will be on top of us before we know it.
C'mon, let's head below deck. I'll help take your mind off the storm.
How do you think you're going to manage that?

Fields.MenuText: I can tell you a story.
Why don't I tell you some jokes?
Why don't we work on your Spanish together?

Fields.DialogueText: What kind of story?
I've heard most of your jokes, Kapitän. But I suppose I wouldn't mind hearing them again.
That wouldn't be a bad idea. I'm sure it will come in handy for whenever I'm able to actually make it back to Spain.
All right, then. Why don't we head to...
Nein, nein, nein... did you feel how much the boat just rocked? Das ist fürchterlich. This is bad, very, very...
Leberecht, you've survived plenty of other storms in the past.
I know... but never a storm like this. Never a storm this massive. Look at it.
Leberecht, I give you my word that I won't let anything happen to you. All of us - every person aboard this ship - will make it through.
... Okay, Kapitän. I'll trust you.
Good. Now, come on. Let's get inside.
Hallo, Kapitän? I need something from you. It won't take long, I promise.
I don't have anything on my plate at the moment. How can I help?
*ALARM*
Looks as if I spoke too soon. Can it wait just a little longer, Leberecht?
Natürlich, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
There you are, Leberecht! I liked the effort you showed out there.
And I didn't accidentally damage myself in the process... so I'd consider that a win.
Now, if I might return to the topic I wished to discuss with you earlier...
Absolutely. Yes, ask away.
I'd like to make my language studies more of a regular activity, and I was wondering whether you might be able to help me.
I'd be happy to. When would you like to start?
Now?
Now? Well, since things have quieted down since the battle, I have some time. Sure. How do you want this to work?
I've made flash cards, see? Read a word in Spanish, and I'll give you the English translation.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, what's el perro?
Sure, what's la mesa?
What's la flor?

Fields.DialogueText: It means the flower.
The dog.
I believe it means the table.
Not... quite. I think you mixed up the translations on the cards, and...
What? Let me see that.
Verdammt. I suppose that just means more studying is in order!
Is it possible that you're worrying so much that it's actually interfering with your language skills? I mean, if you just relaxed and accepted...
Nein. There will be more studying.
Heh. Have fun, Leberecht.
Kapitän, I have a question for you. Why do you put up with me?
Why do I... wait, what?
Sie haben mich schon verstanden, Kapitän. Why do you put up with me?
*ALARM*
We can... continue this conversation in a bit. All right?
Very well.
@BATTLE
All right, Leberecht, let's return to that question you asked me before the battle. It seemed to come out of the blue.
It's a question I've been pondering. You seem to enjoy spending time with me. I wanted to know why.
I'd say there are a lot of reasons, Leberecht.
Ist das wirklich so? Give me an example.

Fields.MenuText: Your smile. It's so warm and cheery. It brightens up my day every time I see it.
Your eyes. There's so much fire and passion in them. They inspire me.
I like your sense of humor. I appreciate someone who's as adept in the art of self-deprecation as I am.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? My teeth aren't too crooked?
You know, if I stare too long, I start to go cross-eyed.
I'm not a master of much, but self-deprecation is certainly a skill I possess.
Ah, just accept the compliment.
But I don't like compliments.
You're just going to have to get used to them then. I'm going to be complimenting you all the time.
Auf gar keinen Fall! I refuse.
We'll see about that.
Hello, Leberecht! I have a present for you. I had the cook make your favorite - Errötende Jungfrau.
Why? There was no reason for you to do that.
Why does there need to be a reason?
There's always a reason for the things we do, Kapitän. Now, be honest. Did you do something?
No... Oh, look! Morganas. We'd better prepare for battle.
@BATTLE
Out with it, Kapitän. What did you do?

Fields.MenuText: I might've accidentally torn a few pages in your Spanish dictionary... I just wanted to look something up.
I was looking at some of the pins in your quarters and one of them rolled under your bed and now I can't find it...
Well... we didn't have buttermilk for the Errötende Jungfrau, so I had them mix regular milk and white vinegar. Does that count?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry yourself over that. I keep multiple copies of the book, just in case I lose one.
I'm sure I'll be able to find it. I'm losing and finding those pins all the time!
I don't know enough about cooking to know how bad that is. You're not trying to poison me, though?
So you forgive me?
Natürlich, although you better be thankful you're adorable when you're contrite. Now, let's go eat that Errötende Jungfrau.
No. Definitely not.
Okay. Good.
So I'm in the clear?
Natürlich - though I may ask you to take the first spoonful of that Errötende Jungfrau.
And... danke, Kapitän.
Hello, Leberecht. What are you up to?
I'm catching Hering... all by myself. Aren't you proud of me?

Fields.MenuText: Of course. Just don't fall overboard this time, all right?
You would do anything for that fish, wouldn't you?
People fish every day, Leberecht. It's not that impressive of a feat.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, shush. You know that wasn't my fault.
Not anything... but many, many, many things? Certainly. It's delicious.
People walk every day, but they're still impressed when a baby takes their first steps. ... Not that I'm, you know... a baby.
Whoa. Those things are distinctly... pungent. How long have they been sitting out in the sun?
Only a little while. What, you're not bothered by the smell of a few fish, are you, great Kapitän der sieben Weltmeere?
Shouldn't it be against the rules to tease your Captain?
Das ist Unsinn. It's how I keep you humble.
*ALARM*
Well, with any luck, those fish will be swept over during this battle.
They'll be fine. I'm planning on storing them in your quarters.
Don't joke about things like that. Leberecht? Leberecht!
@BATTLE
Leberecht... are you following me?
Schon möglich. Heh. That's for me to know and you to find out.
But I just found out. What's the point of this?
I was just trying to see how bothered you would get by my following you.

Fields.MenuText: Well, too bad! Nothing gets to me.
I have to admit, it is kind of annoying.
Would you be satisfied if I tell you it bothers me a lot?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I'm sure something does. And I'm sure I'll find it, sooner or later.
Ja! My mission was successful.
Only if you're telling the truth.
I don't understand why you feel the need to bother me... you're not in need of my attention, are you?
What? Nein. That's crazy. I don't need attention from you. The Nixen give me all the attention I need. They're around often enough... Look! Here they are now.
@BATTLE
Kapitän? What are you doing, sitting there?
Oh, I thought I would work on some paperwork in your quarters. That way, you can get all the attention you could possibly need from me.
It's cute that you think my world revolves around you...  but don't flatter yourself, Kapitän.
It's not my fault you're in love with me.
Ah, ja. Because I'm the one who's camped myself in your quarters.

Fields.MenuText: ... Fair enough.
So, just to be clear... you're saying you're not in love with me?
You wish you could camp yourself in my quarters.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't just win a battle of wits, did I? ... This has never happened before.
Wait... you're not seriously asking me that question, are you?
I'm the ship. Technically, I am your quarters.
... All I'm looking for from you is an admission that you have been wanting my attention more than usual, recently.
... Nixen are coming this way. We'll have to pick up this conversation... later.
Very well.
@BATTLE
Ja. Let that sink in.
Hello, Leberecht.
Hallo, Kapitän. You've been smiling quite a bit, recently. Why that face? It's a little creepy.
It's nothing, nothing... I just may have overheard some important information.
Something pertaining to our mission?
No, no. Not that important. I overheard some of the other crew members talking and it seems that they believe a certain couple on board have feelings for one another.
Rumors are nasty things, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: Some of them are meant to be believed, though. Don't you find?
Fine, fine. I guess I shouldn't be eavesdropping anyway. Sometimes, though, I just can't help myself.
As the captain of this ship, it's my responsibility to keep an ear to the ground. If a mutiny is coming my way, I want to know about it ahead of time.

Fields.DialogueText: ... It depends on the situation.
Most of the people on this ship are gossips, anyway. Don't listen to a word they say.
Rest assured, Kapitän. If a mutiny were being discussed, I would bring it to your attention before any serious threat was mounted.
Still... what do you think about the rumor? About the couple?
Kapitän... Verdammt, the Nixen are back. We need to get everyone together. Let's go.
You have to be kidding me.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, there's something I really need to talk to you about.
You know you can tell me anything. What is it?
Ich wollte nur sagen... I mean, I...
I just spotted some Nixen. ... That's not what I wanted to tell you, but this is more important. I'll talk to you about it later.
@BATTLE
Good work out there, Leberecht. Now, tell me. What's going on?
Kapitän... I... I have a friend who's never been in a relationship before.
Okay.
And she's, well... she thinks she might be developing feelings for someone... but she's unsure as to whether or not she'd be able to make a relationship work.

Fields.MenuText: Tell your friend to take her time, then. She shouldn't jump into things she's not ready for.
I'd say she should take the leap. Sometimes action is the only way to know what we're capable of.
I'm not sure I'm the one who should be giving your friend advice. That sounds like something she really needs to figure out on her own.

Fields.DialogueText: That's true...  rushing into things never works out well anyway.
That makes sense. Although, this friend isn't known for taking to new situations with Aplomb.
I suppose, in the end, whether or not to take action really is up to her.
Do you think my answer will help... your friend?
Ja, ja. I better go... write my friend to convey your advice. My apologies if I bothered you.
Leberecht? Leberecht. Is that you?
Um... Nein?
Have you been avoiding me?
Nein.
...Maybe. Ja.

Fields.MenuText: Was it something I did? Please tell me if I've hurt you in any way.
Should I be offended? I'm a little hurt by that...
Could you tell me what's going on? We had been getting along so well.

Fields.DialogueText: Nein. Of course not. You didn't do anything wrong.
It's not because I don't like you. Please don't be offended.
You're right, we have been getting along.
*ALARM*
Damn them and their inopportune timing.
We can speak after the battle, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
So? Out with it.
... I didn't want to be a bother. I overheard some crew members talking about me following you around like a gnat. I didn't like the thought of that at all.
Leberecht. That's ridiculous. I don't care what other people think or say. I like spending time with you. You don't need to avoid me.
Danke, Kapitän. That's a relief to hear.
So, we're all right?
Yes. We're all right.
Thanks for meeting me for a stroll around deck. I love taking a nice walk.
Was there anything you wanted to talk about?
Nein, nothing in particular. Do you want to talk about anything?
There's maybe... something on my mind.

Fields.MenuText: How's your friend doing? You know, the one with the relationship... issues?
Have you ever been in love, Leberecht?
What's your opinion on love at first sight?

Fields.DialogueText: She... she's still thinking over what to do next.
Maybe? It's hard to tell. Love's a tricky thing to gauge, I think.
I believe it can happen, but those are the flighty relationships. Real, true, deep love takes a longer time to grow and blossom.
Fair enough.
Is there anything else you would like to say?
Yes, actually. I... I see the Morganas on the horizon. We'll have to put this conversation on hold for the time being. I promise we'll resume later.
Ja. Natürlich.
@BATTLE
Kapitän. There you are. I have a question for you that I couldn't hold in any longer. Are-
Your question will have to wait, Leberecht. Morganas are incoming.
... Super.
@BATTLE
Sorry for interrupting you, Leberecht. What was your question?
I was just going to ask you whether you're comfortable with all this relationship talk we've been having recently.
You're the Kapitän, after all. Your station requires propriety.

Fields.MenuText: I don't mind, Leberecht. Not in the least!
As long as our conversations don't interfere with our duties or affect the crew, I see no issue with them.
If you think we need to take a step back... I'll follow your lead.

Fields.DialogueText: That's good to know... but I don't want us to set a bad example for the crew.
I suppose you're right. Still, I think it's good for us to be wary of crossing that line.
Thank you for understanding, Kapitän.
I have some paperwork I need to get to, Leberecht. I'd better get going.
Oh! Of course - natürlich müssen sie... das. Don't let me keep you. Bye!
Hallo, Kapitän.
Leberecht.
What are you doing?
More paperwork. I'm afraid I let it pile up longer than I should have.
Um. Sind wir... ?
Are we what?
Are we all right? You've seemed a little distant since our last conversation.

Fields.MenuText: Sometimes, paperwork is just paperwork, Leberecht. We're fine. Really.
During our last conversation, you indicated that there should be more space between us.
I've just been working through a few things, Leberecht. There's no reason for you to worry.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, good. I'm relieved. Thanks for putting me at ease, Kapitän.
I know... but I wasn't expecting you to shut me out entirely.
Well, good. Let me know if I can do anything to help.
I guess I'll be on my way. I don't want to distract you.
Leberecht?
Ja, Kapitän?
Tell your friend... the one with the relationship issues, that she shouldn't wait too long before deciding what to do about her feelings.
Whether or not she pursues them, eventually... a choice just has to be made.
... I assure you, Kapitän, she's trying her best.
*ALARM*
Get ready for battle.
Natürlich. Sie können sich auf mich verlassen.
@BATTLE
I suppose I haven't been incredibly mature about all of this.
Leberecht? Leberecht! I need you.
I'm not sure I'm the best person to call if you're facing a crisis, but I'll do what I can to help. Where's the problem?
Look. Look there.
And where did all of that come from?
One of our more industrious crew members thought he would smuggle them on board and sell them once he returned home. He's spending the next few days in the brig.
He really thought he could keep them a secret? Ha!
I'm going to have to fill out a lot of paperwork to sort out this mess... think you could lend a hand?
Let me at that paperwork. It won't know what hit it!
Heh. Thanks, Leberecht. ... I know that, no matter what happens in the future, I can always count on you.
Don't you forget that, Kapitän.
... All right! Ready to get started?
Would you like some poorly-made coffee now or later?
*ALARM*
Why don't you make the coffee now, and then we can try chucking it at the Morganas?
That'll work!
@BATTLE
Those carefully ventilated crates contain about four dozen geckos, along with what I really, really hope is enough food, water and... I don't know, straw? Whatever - enough to keep them going.
Kapitän? Are you busy?
Not at the moment. What do you need from me?
You know the ship newspaper?
... Sure.
Be honest.
I'm... vaguely aware of its existence. It only ever amounts to a few pages published by a couple sailors every few weeks, doesn't it?
Well, it's not as if the crew has a lot in the way of resources to put it together.
Fair enough.
Anyway! There's a question of the day members of the crew are being asked for the next issue, and I've been tasked with asking you the question.
Heh. Very well.
Would you rather live in the past, present, or future?

Fields.MenuText: Past, I guess. I love history, and having the opportunity to see it unfold with my own eyes would be a thrill.
The present, definitely. I like my life as it is right now and I wouldn't want to change a thing.
The future. I'd love to travel to a couple hundred years from now and see all the advancements humankind has made.

Fields.DialogueText: Medicine was terrible back then, though. You would probably die within a week.
You don't long to experience something new?
You're not scared that something bad might happen in the future?
Not satisfied with my answer, eh? And, out of curiosity, how did you end up being tasked with asking me this question?
I requested the assignment. I thought I would learn a lot about you based on your answer... which I did.
Well, that's a little disconcerting. Any other questions?
Jetzt ist nicht die Zeit dafür. The you-know-whos are back.
@BATTLE
Thanks for the vote of confidence.
I could have said a day.
Leberecht! I have a question for you.
I can't guarantee I'll know the answer, but I'll try my best. What would you like to know?
I think you'll know the answer. The question is about you.

Fields.MenuText: What's your favorite flower?
What kind of jewelry do you like?
What's a great gift someone could give you?

Fields.DialogueText: I love roses. They're so beautiful, and I think their smell is one of the loveliest in the world.
Hm... that's a strange question, but I like brooches, I suppose.
This is going to sound so inane, but here it goes... I'd really like a little fish fork. For herring. I love it and it would make a great conversation starter.
Why do you ask?
No reason...
... Was? Nein, for a question that strange, you have to have a reason.
If you get to ask me questions, I get to ask you questions, newspaper or no.
I suppose that's only fair.
*ALARM*
I should have known they were coming. It had been quiet too long.
They do like disturbing the peace.
@BATTLE
The ocean is beautiful, isn't it?
I try not to look at it.
Where was your attention, then?
I was just thinking about Spain. It's still out there, waiting for me.

Fields.MenuText: A country can't really be waiting for you...
Are you still focused on that? Don't you have any other dreams?
I'm certain you'll return soon. Just be patient.

Fields.DialogueText: You're wrong. Spain wants me to return as much as I do.
Well, there's no reason to be rude about it. Spain is a perfectly worthwhile dream to have.
I hope you're right. This means the world to me.
What if I were to take you there?
Wie meinst du das? We would go there... together?
It's a thought. We're due some R&R, and there's no reason why we couldn't take a bit of a bit of a break at a Spanish port. You and the crew have earned it.
That... that would be marvelous!
*ALARM*
There's still a lot we would need to discuss. But I see no reason why we couldn't make your dream a reality. Now... let's go deal with these Morganas.
I'm going to work extra hard not to sink during this battle!
@BATTLE
You're right... sorry, I shouldn't have snapped at you.
Apology accepted.
Pfennig for your thoughts?
I wouldn't want to burden you with these thoughts. They're a waste of brain space.
Well, I doubt that. And it isn't good for anyone to keep their thoughts bottled up.
Ach hör auf. It doesn't matter.
Clearly, it matters to you. And if it matters to you, it matters to me.
*ALARM*
Can we talk again after the battle?
I suppose...
@BATTLE
All right, Leberecht. What's going on?
I've been trying to make more of an effort at making friends, but nothing I've tried has worked. Everyone still thinks I'm bad luck. I just wish I had some friends.

Fields.MenuText: You have no friends? Then what am I? I'm offended. Of-friend-ed.
Maybe I could help you with your social skills.
So, what am I? Chopped liver?

Fields.DialogueText: ... I don't know if I want to be friends with you after that. Heh.
You think that could help?
Of course you're my friend, Kapitän. But multiple avenues of support would be nice.
Whatever I can do to help, Leberecht, I'm willing to do.
Ich danke dir sehr, Kapitän.
There's only one way to find out.
Whoa, Leberecht. Watch where you're shooting.
Es tut mir leid, Kapitän. Sorry, sorry, sorry! I was just trying to practice.
Do you need any help? Here, let me teach you a few things.
Okay, what's the most important thing I should know?

Fields.MenuText: You don't aim dead center. Wind direction and speed and the distance and speed of your target are all important things to consider. There are a million factors to account for.
Well, first of all, you really shouldn't close your eyes while shooting.
Make sure the crew is well aware of when you're about to shoot.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I know... but it would really make things easier if I didn't have to think about such things.
I had one eye open!
I can see why they'd appreciate a little warning.
Do you have some free time tomorrow? I could give you some more pointers.
That would be a big help! ... Thanks so much for be willing to teach me, Kapitän.
When you're at your best, we're all at our best.
*ALARM*
All right. Time to put what you taught me into practice.
You can do it, Leberecht. I have faith in you.
@BATTLE
Feel that breeze, Leberecht! I wish the weather was always like this.
You're awfully happy. What's brightened your mood?
The sky is clear and the waters are calm. Why not be happy?
Well, I just put out a kitchen fire of my own making, so I'm not in the best mood ever.
Come on now, Leberecht. Don't be so hard on yourself. You're still afloat, after all.
Das ist richtig. I suppose...
Here! A florist was selling roses by the dock. I thought I would buy one for you.
It's beautiful! Thank you, Kapitän... I love the way it smells.

Fields.MenuText: You don't mind that one of its petals is a little crumpled?
I would have bought you a whole dozen... but that florist drove a hard bargain.
The smell of the rose distracts from the lingering smell of smoke from the kitchen fire.

Fields.DialogueText: That just gives it more character!
Ha! One's more than enough for me, Kapitän.
Hey, now! Be nice.
*ALARM*
You had better go put that rose in a safe place. And don't trip and fall on it on the way!
I'll... I'll do my best!
@BATTLE
Sorry. I couldn't resist.
Well, there you are, Leberecht. Are you going for a stroll too?
I am. Would you like to join me?
Of course. I always enjoy our walks together.
So why are you out for a walk?

Fields.MenuText: I needed a break from the paperwork I've been working on.
I like taking a walk around this time. I always feel so calm once I've finished my rounds.
The IO and I had a bit of an argument. I figured it would be a good idea to get some fresh air.

Fields.DialogueText: Paperwork is never fun. I can see why you would want to get out here.
I understand completely. Walks have a way of clearing my head.
What?! Don't worry, I'll write an apology card on your behalf.
I love the light around this time. It just makes everything look so... lovely.
I'd never noticed it before, but I think you're right, Kapitän.
It's a shame we don't have a photographer on board.
That's why we have memories. If we both make the effort to remember this moment, it will be the next best thing to a photograph.
I'll remember if you will.
Good! Sehr gut!
*ALARM*
They certainly know how to ruin a moment.
Let's go ruin theirs.
@BATTLE
How do you know I was the one at fault?
I mean, I was. But I'm not always.
Leberecht, can you come here for a second?
Natürlich, Kapitän. Did I do something wrong?
What? No, you haven't done anything wrong. Why do you just assume that every time I ask for you?
I assume that's a rhetorical question. What was it that you needed, Kapitän?
I have something for you. One of the sailors forced me into buying some of their handcrafted wares they're selling on the side. Now I'm giving them away as gifts.
Ha! You really can't turn down a good sales pitch, can you? Well, show me what you have.

Fields.MenuText: A necklace. I thought it would look pretty on you.
It might seem silly, but I got you a little fish fork. You know... because you like herring so much.
A brooch. The sailor who made it is German. I thought it might remind you of home.

Fields.DialogueText: It's lovely, Kapitän. In fact, it might be a little too lovely for a Belle such as myself.
Ah! It's so cute. I love it.
You know me so well... thank you, Kapitän.
Here, take it. It's for you, and you deserve it after all the hard work you've done.
I don't think I've done that much hard work. My fighting skills are still pretty rusty.
*ALARM*
I'm confident this fight will prove otherwise.
Heh. We'll see.
@BATTLE
Leberecht! There you are. Where have you been recently?
I've just been thinking about... some things.
Things?
Mmhmm.

Fields.MenuText: Like the latest naval siege methods?
Like what new weapons we should buy for you next?
Like... pie?

Fields.DialogueText: Not once in my life.
Honestly, I'm pretty pleased with the weapons I have now.
I wasn't thinking about pie... although, now I am.
All right, then. Out with it.
I was thinking about my friend. You know, the one with the relationship issues.
Really? Any thoughts in particular?
Just that...
*ALARM*
Why, Kapitän. You're clenching that railing pretty tightly.
I'm... fine. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Leberecht? ... Leberecht! There you are.
I think we've kept missing each other. It seems like you're always asleep or on duty whenever I have a moment to myself.
Well, I'm here now. And I was hoping we might continue that conversation from earlier.
You're really... invested in how my friend's doing, aren't you?
What can I say? I'm a very... uh... caring captain.
*ALARM*
Of all the rotten timing...
Don't worry, Kapitän. I'll fill you in after the battle.
@BATTLE
So?
Your friend?
Ha! R-right, well...
Well...
I think...
... You think?
Ja! I think... I'm going to... encourage my friend to pursue... a certain relationship.
Is that a fact?
That's the plan. We'll... uh... see how it goes.
Well then... I can't wait to hear what happens next.
